description:
A name and coordinate pair is saved to the DB(more on this in the next section).
Each coordinate pair makes use of the user's discord ID to differentiate between other users.

Pretty self-explanatory. What's cool about this method is that Lapis will
programmatically get the user's ID, so they will always only retrieve their saved coordinates.

Delete a saved location and its corresponding image if one exists.
Same deal with Lapis' other CRUD operations - gets the user ID automatically.
Probably the most useful command, shows every location a user has made.
Store an image for a saved location.
Delete an image stored for a location.
Lapis can lookup information for an MC world, the seed used is saved to a user's discord ID and cached for frequent use.
Retrieve the seed for a user.
Find the nearest structure or biome.
Find up to 10 seeds matching some criteria.
All of Lapis' commands, in-depth on usage w/ examples.
